page.title: 14Transport
page.content: The majority of families in the Hoath own a car. This is necessary because of the rural nature of the countryside and the inadequate public transport facilities. School children are taken each day by bus to{Chiddingstone.}This travels on to{Edenbridge}with the 9+ age group. Once a week there is a bus service to the nearby town of Tunbridge Wells, leaving the Hoath at 10.30 hrs & returning at 15.00 hrs. Once a fortnight Senior Citizens can use a mini bus to shop in Edenbridge, this service is run by the Rotary Club. During the summer once a week on Sundays, a bus travels through the Hoath, touring villages, on a circular route from Sevenoaks.
